content: Buy the full {{license}} version to get:

comment.text: This translation key is used to display a message encouraging users to purchase the full version of a product. It appears as a banner header in a benefits container and will be displayed when the user is on a trial plan, prompting them to buy the full license to access its features.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Aşağıdakıları əldə etmək üçün tam {{license}} versiyasını alın:' is a bit literal and could be improved for natural flow. 'Get the full {{license}} version to get:' implies getting something *in addition* to the full version. A more natural phrasing would indicate what the user gets.

The English phrase 'Buy the full' is better translated as 'Koupit plnou' or 'Pořiďte si plnou' in Czech. 'Zakoupením plné' implies a past action and isn't quite as direct or compelling for a call to action.

The translation 'Erwerben Sie die vollständige {{license}}-Version und erhalten Sie:' doesn't fully capture the meaning of 'Buy the full {{license}} version to get:'. While 'Erwerben Sie' means 'Buy' and 'erhalten Sie' means 'receive', the flow is less natural. It's more accurately 'Buy the full {{license}} version and you will receive:'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Erwerben Sie die vollständige {{license}}-Version und Sie erhalten:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Αγοράστε την πλήρη έκδοση {{license}} για να αποκτήσετε τα παρακάτω:' is a literal translation that doesn't quite convey the intent of 'Buy the full {{license}} version to get:'.  'Αποκτήσετε τα παρακάτω' translates to 'to acquire the following', which is less direct and compelling than 'to get'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more natural and engaging translation like 'Αγοράστε την πλήρη έκδοση {{license}} για να λάβετε:' (to receive) or 'Αγοράστε την πλήρη έκδοση {{license}} και αποκτήστε:' (and get).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Armenian translation "Գնեք ամբողջական {{license}} տարբերակը, ստանալու համար:" is a bit literal and sounds unnatural. A more natural phrasing would emphasize the benefit of upgrading.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider "Ամբողջական {{license}} տարբերակը գնելուց հետո՝ դուք կստանաք:" (After purchasing the full {{license}} version, you will receive:)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "すべての機能を利用するには、{{license}}の完全版を購入してください" is a bit too literal and formal. It translates to "To use all functions, please purchase the full version of {{license}}". A more natural and user-friendly translation would focus on the benefit, such as "Unlock all features by purchasing the full {{license}} version".
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Unlock all features by purchasing the full {{license}} version.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "Buy the full {{license}} version to get:" is best translated with a slightly more natural Korean phrasing. The current translation, "{{license}} 정식 버전 구매 시 혜택:" literally translates to 'Benefits when you purchase the full {{license}} version'. It's technically correct but lacks the implied invitation to action from the original.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: {{license}} 정식 버전 구매 시 다음 혜택을 받으세요: ({{license}} full version purchase to receive the following benefits)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The term 'license' in the English content should ideally be translated to a Lao equivalent that accurately conveys the meaning of a software license.  'ບູລິມະນູກຳ' (burimanookham) is closer to 'priority' or 'privilege' and doesn't directly translate 'license'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more precise translation for 'license' such as 'ໃບອະນຸຍາດ' (baianuyat) which means 'permit' or 'license', or a more descriptive phrase like 'ສັນຍາຊົມໃຊ້ເຕັມຮູບແບບ' (sanyachomchai tem ruupbaep) which means 'full usage agreement'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "Iegādājieties pilnu {{license}} versiju, lai iegūtu:" is a bit literal and slightly awkward in Latvian. A more natural phrasing would convey the benefit more clearly.

The translation "Koop de volledige {{license}} versie en ontvang het volgende:" doesn't quite capture the meaning of 'to get:'. 'Ontvang het volgende' translates to 'receive the following,' which is slightly different than 'to get'. A more accurate translation would convey the benefit gained from the purchase.

The translation "Cumpărați versiunea completă {{license}} și obțineți:" is a bit literal and could be more natural. 'Obțineți' (you obtain) isn't the most fluid way to express this. It implies a direct acquisition, while 'get' in the English version is more general.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Cumpărați versiunea completă {{license}} pentru a obține:

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "පූර්ණ {{license}} අනුවර්තනය මිලදී ගෙන පහත දේ ලබා ගන්න:" is a literal translation and doesn't flow naturally in Sinhala for a banner headline. It's a bit clunky. A more natural phrasing would be something like 'ඔබේ {{license}} අනුවර්තනය වැඩිදියුණු කරන්න'
The colon at the end of the sentence (":") may not be stylistically appropriate for a banner headline in Sinhala. It's common to omit colons in such contexts.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the colon at the end of the sentence.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Zakúpením plnej verzie {{license}} získate:' while technically correct, is a bit formal and less engaging for a banner encouraging upgrades. A more natural phrasing might be more suitable.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'Objednajte si plnú verziu {{license}} a získate:' or 'S plnou verziou {{license}} získate:'

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'верзију' is spelled correctly. However, depending on context, 'издање' might be a more natural and precise translation for 'version' in this context (particularly when referring to software licenses).
The use of Cyrillic script is consistent and appropriate for the target language.

The translation 'Aşağıdakileri elde etmek için Tam {{license}} Sürümünü satın alın:' is a bit literal and sounds slightly awkward in Turkish. A more natural phrasing would be something like 'Tam {{license}} sürümünü satın alarak şunları edinin:' or 'Şunları elde etmek için Tam {{license}} sürümünü satın alın:'
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Şunları elde etmek için Tam {{license}} sürümünü satın alın:
